newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Ahold sees growing Asian possibilities.
newsitem.headline: Ahold sees growing Asian possibilities.

text.p: Dutch supermarkets group Ahold NV said on Thursday it saw major opportunities in Asian markets.
"We are very, very optimistic on the long term future in Asia. We expect to reach break-even in the year 2000," board member Eddy Moerck told a results news conference.
Moerck said Ahold was working on further expansion in Asia.
"The potential for supermarkets in Asia is enormous. And we are a fair distance ahead of our competitors," Moerck said.
He said Ahold had tackled the region successfully, by finding local partners in the various countries.
He said the group also derived significant advantages from its single name strategy in Asia in the areas of synergy and private labelling.
Ahold chairman Cees van der Hoeven said the joint-venture agreements Ahold entered into with Asian and other partners were intended to last for the long term.

"These are long term partnerships. I don't rule out the possible expansion of our stake (in these ventures) one day, but we did not agree anything particular on that at the moment of signing," he said.
He said the partners had agreed to offer Ahold first right of refusal if they decided to sell.
